resources.string:
\begin{presentation} \title Sample Presentation: Speeches
\begin{cuecard}[color=lime, endpause=true] % Background color is lime, expect
 % a pause (pause of length, in seconds,
 % > 1 standard deviation from pauses in
 % cuecard duration) after last point on
 % cue-card back is spoken

 \point Speeches often start with a hook %front of cuecard

 \begin{details}[color=salmon] %back of cuecard
 \item A hook is anything that grabs the audience's attention
 \item Examples of hooks are anecdotes, jokes, $"hot takes"$ %strings enclosed with "$" will be highlighted
 \item Knowing targed audience leads to better hooks %switch to next cue card when this item is spoken
 \end{details}

 \end{cuecard}

 \begin{cuecard} %no color or endpause specified. Default values of color=white and endpause=true will be used.

 \point Bottom line upfront

 \begin{details}
 \item The audience needs to first know why they should pay attention to your speech
 \item[color=red] Then, deliver on your promise
 \end{details}

 \end{cuecard}

 \end{presentation}
